alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Haskell; McIntosh; Pittsburg; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:49AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Haskell, McIntosh, western Sequoyah, southern Adair, southeastern Wagoner, southern Cherokee, northeastern Pittsburg, southeastern Okmulgee and Muskogee Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 248 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Fort Gibson to 6 miles north of Stidham. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Sallisaw... Eufaula... Stigler... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Warner... Morris... Vian... Quinton... Gore... Porum... Okay... Webbers Falls... Porter... Whitefield... Oktaha... Kinta... Marble City... Braggs... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 248 and 307. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
